Energy Efficiency in Product Transportation
Ross does not own our fleet of trucks. However, 
because we know the impact of transporting our 
products is likely a relevant source of indirect  
emissions, we employed several strategies in 2019  
to make product transportation more sustainable:
Shipments were consolidated where possible  
to reduce the number of trips to stores each day.
Approximately 39% of our products were 
shipped by rail, which is less polluting than 
standard ground transportation.
Over 80% of our transportation partners 
participated in the SmartWay Transport 
Partnership, a U.S. Environmental Protection 
Agency program that improves fuel efficiency 
and reduces air pollution.
The capacity of each trailer was maximized 
through floor-loading and removing unnecessary 
packaging, leading to fewer shipments.
A project to optimize the delivery routes in a 
number of our markets resulted in a reduction  
of more than 1.8 million over-the-road miles.
